com.tomtom.speedtools.akka.tokenbucket

Class TokenBucketImpl

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.tomtom.speedtools.akka.tokenbucket.TokenBucketImpl
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    TokenBucket

    public class TokenBucketImpl
extends Object
implements TokenBucket
    Note: this implementation could be made more efficient, by only scheduling a timer when there are not enough tokens to acquire, and compute the number of tokens based on time.

    • Nested Class Summary

      • Nested classes/interfaces inherited from interface com.tomtom.speedtools.akka.tokenbucket.TokenBucket

      • acquireToken

        public void acquireToken(@Nonnull
                         TokenBucket.TokenAcceptor tokenAcceptor)
        Description copied from interface: TokenBucket
        Acquire a token from the bucket. When a token becomes available, TokenAcceptor.tokenAcquired() will be called.
        Specified by:
        acquireToken in interface TokenBucket
        Parameters:
        tokenAcceptor - the callback to use.

      • flushTokens

        public void flushTokens()
        Description copied from interface: TokenBucket
        Flush any remaining tokens in the bucket (useful after, e.g., token rate changes).
        Specified by:
        flushTokens in interface TokenBucket

      • multiplyTokenRate

        public void multiplyTokenRate(double factor)
        Description copied from interface: TokenBucket
        Change the rate of generating new tokens by multiplying with factor. Note that the rate will be limited (both upper and lower bound) in the implementation, specified when the actor is instantiated.
        Specified by:
        multiplyTokenRate in interface TokenBucket
        Parameters:
        factor - The factor to multiply the rate with. Must be > 0.

      • isEmpty

        @Nonnull
public scala.concurrent.Future<Boolean> isEmpty()
        Description copied from interface: TokenBucket
        Returns whether there are any tokens left in this bucket. Note that this does not guarantee that a token can be acquired, since someone else could be first to acquire the token.
        Specified by:
        isEmpty in interface TokenBucket
        Returns:
        Whether there are any tokens left.

        Description copied from interface: TokenBucket
        Internal method called from scheduler to increment the number of tokens in the bucket.
